text.p: Cadus Pharmaceutical Corp said Monday it will move its Lakewood, Colo., operations to its Tarrytown, N.Y., headquarters.
The company said in a statement it expects the move to be completed by Sept 30.
Cadus said it offered transfers to the Tarrytown facility for the 11 scientists and one administrative assistant who make up the Cadus staff in Lakewood.

Cadus said it established the temporary Lakewood facility in 1995 to facilitate the initial transfer of technology from the National Jewish Center for Immunology and Respiratory Medicine. Cadus licensed certain drug discovery technologies from the Center, the company said in a statement.
Cadus shares in late Nasdaq trading were up 5/16 at 13-5/16.
